Reviews.Title: Very happy!
Reviews.Author: JB "Devoted Amazonian since 1996"
Reviews.Content: For those of you who are already using a tablet of some sort, you'll be right at home with this machine.  I'm running Win8.1 Enterprise on it and couldn't be happier with its performance and overall enhancement to my workday.  I LOVE being able to use the on-screen touch keyboard for quick purposes, and using this machine is breaking my dependence on the mouse.This machine comes pre-loaded with Win8 Home, which meant I had to blow it away in order to use it for work.  For users who plan to join to a domain, know this ahead of time.  Do yourself a favor and save the ASUS SmartGesture files for the touchpad, else your life will be a pain with the touchpad until you download the software from the vendor, more on that below.Be advised:  this machine does NOT come with a CD/DVD drive, though it is mentioned in the product description.  If this is a deal-breaker, look for another touchscreen laptop.  This machine is very thin and very light, and there is no room for any optical drive.It'd be a good starter machine for someone who's accustomed to tablets.  Leaping into this setup after only knowing desktops or traditional laptops, ehhhh...I won't lie:  Win8/8.1 has a learning curve.  I've used every version Microsoft OS since Win3.1, and I have to say, this one took me a while to get the hang of, but now that I do, I LOVE IT.  Win8.1 and this touchscreen laptop are a fantastic couple.PROS:1. Very lightweight, excellent if you have to tote it around all day or if it's on your back as you're barreling through an airport.2. Works seamlessly with Win8.1 and Office365.3. Great sound quality for listening to music, presentations, or doing meetings over VOIP.4. Keyboard is great for even the lightest touch.  You won't be banging on these keys unless you're angry at something else.5.  Good, clear video display and excellent touch response--you won't be poking icons over and over to get something to open, that's for sure.6.  Insanely quiet machine--I barely know it's on because I don't hear its fans at all, though I know they're working.  You could use this next to someone sleeping, and they wouldn't know you had a computer in the bed.  My other laptop sounds like it's getting ready to taxi down a runway.CONS:1.  The CAPS lock key doesn't have a LED to indicate when it's active.  ASUS, why?  Was this too expensive an option for your users?  This is the first laptop I've ever owned that didn't have a light-up CAPS key.  Seems like small beans to complain about until YOU'RE SCREAMING AT EVERYONE BECAUSE YOU FORGOT CAPS IS ON.2.  The touchpad is enormous.  Now, if you're a fan of tap-to-click, then you'll love the vast expanse of touchpad real estate.  If, however, you're like me, tap-to-click is a giant pain in the ass.  There isn't a feature in the touchpad software where you can disable this with one click--in the SmartGesture software, simply uncheck all the boxes for one-finger, etc.  This is the ONLY way to disable the touchpad without disabling your mouse.3.  No CD/DVD drive present on this machine.  Given that so much exists or is accessible in the cloud, I get why they eliminated this hardware.  Still, it doesn't belong in the product description.4. Only two USB slots--unless you plan to tote a hub around with you, you're not hooking all your devices to this laptop.  There's one on each side.  There are no ports for anything on the back of the machine.5.  NO REMOVABLE BATTERY.  That's right...once it's gone, it's gone.  I expect the manufacturer believes that your average laptop has a shelf life of 3-4 years before you'll replace it.  I have a traditional laptop that's about 4, and yes, it's time to buy a new battery, but at least I have the option to make that laptop last me a little longer with a replaceable battery.

Reviews.Title: Good Overall Laptop
Reviews.Author: Russell Youngberg
Reviews.Content: As with any other laptop there are both good and bad things with the ASUS VivoBook. I love the touchscreen functionality and the keyboard. I think the mouse pad is a little bit oversized, but some people might like it that way. It was quite a bit heavier than I was expecting, but it won't be too hard to get used to. I was also expecting it to feel a little more metalic, but it feels like a heavy plastic. Overall, it is a good laptop and I would recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: I'm COOL with this laptop.
Reviews.Author: fu sheng
Reviews.Content: It works as expected. I like the key board.Thanks to some new technology developed by ASUS it stays cool, which is a very nice feature.

Reviews.Title: Great Laptop!
Reviews.Author: Emily Phipps
Reviews.Content: I've had a lot of experience with computers & tablets for school and work usage. After having minimal success with the HP Envy x2 Convertible Tablet/Laptop, I've found my favorite touch & Windows 8 compatible computer. The ASUS definitely prides itself on fast functionality coupled with great compatibility for Windows 8 and all of its features. Also, having touch screen makes it very easy to navigate the Start Screen and access all the computer can provide.

Reviews.Title: This is a decent laptop.
Reviews.Author: mengjian
Reviews.Content: This laptop is thin and light, the keyboard is comfortable so far.The design is very nice and everything is working perfectly, the touchscreen is awesome,the batterylife is good. The price is also good.So far everything is OK, I recommend the laptop.

Reviews.Title: A decent laptop for the price
Reviews.Author: hongge high
Reviews.Content: The computer runs smoothly in all aspects and I like the comfortable feeling of the keybord. The touchscreen is a feature that I didn't think I would use, however, it's very convenient. Although this is not as great as the top line product of ASUS,  it worths the price and works perfect for me.

Reviews.Title: So far so good. I ordered this laptop after seeing a similar ...
Reviews.Author: Jordan H.
Reviews.Content: So far so good.  I ordered this laptop after seeing a similar model in a local electronics store.  It came very quickly to me and so far it has been great.  The only downside is that it gets pretty warm when sitting on my lap.  Most of the time it is used by other members of the family, but this was their only complaint so far.  The touchscreen is working well and the speed/performance is great for simple needs.

Reviews.Title: This is an awesome laptop.
Reviews.Author: Cheryl L. Kienast "Cardipower"
Reviews.Content: This is my first laptop, which I got to take to meetings and events.  It starts up very quickly and is easy to use.  I was worried about the 8.1 Windows operating system as people had said it was difficult to use.  I have not found that to be true.  I downloaded a free tutorial which gave me useful information and was able to produce documents, send e-mails, surf the web and access my Facebook account very quickly and easily.

Reviews.Title: Super Deal
Reviews.Author: alan ng
Reviews.Content: Nice laptop! evrething works fine for a normal user, i can user photoshop and illustrators.. and work fine for basic games

Reviews.Title: Good Computer for the price
Reviews.Author: J. Stewart
Reviews.Content: The first one I received had a defective screen out of the box but that could happen with any brand.  This is a well built machine with sturdy components, a nice touch screen, and is lightweight. For under $500, I don't think you will find a better Ultrabook with a touchscreen.

Reviews.Title: Like it a lot.
Reviews.Author: A. Daiza "Drew"
Reviews.Content: Great laptop, got it for my dad who is a business man and he loves it. Keyboard is nice and has a nice feel. Good mid range travel/home laptop. One of the best in the price range that I've seen. Would buy again.

Reviews.Title: Good computer, just a little slow.
Reviews.Author: Nima Beheshtian
Reviews.Content: I dont know if its a software issue but this computer takes a while to load up pages. It looks great and the touch screen is actually very useful, but its slow. I might look into installing an SSD but I will have to see if there is room.All in all, good computer for the price.

Reviews.Title: Great Piece
Reviews.Author: Robert Ampene Appiah "Rob"
Reviews.Content: I received my machine timely as advertised, a week ago. I quickly set it up and loved how sleek it is. The touch is smooth, just like my Lumia phone. It runs smoothly. Though I initially had issues with the absence of the DVD drive advertised by amazon, it was swiftly explained and resolved by the supplier. So far all is well. I love this machine.

Reviews.Title: Purchased two if these
Reviews.Author: ld "mom/nurse"
Reviews.Content: I bought two of these laptops, one for my college student son to have something more portable on campus and one for myself to use exclusively for work. My son loves his, size features and usability are great for him. I'm not quite so thrilled. This laptop is still kind of heavy but I do like how thin it is, doesn't take up too much space in my briefcase. I wish it had a numbers pad. And I hate Windows 8 but that is not a commentary on the hardware. The whole purchase was a necessary evil for me, I needed remote access to my work system, so I'll just have to get used to it.

Reviews.Title: Awesome!
Reviews.Author: anthony vitanza
Reviews.Content: My daughter love it ! Nice size for travel, not too heavy in a backpack. Small enough to be easily portable

Reviews.Title: Review of this asus computer
Reviews.Author: RBS
Reviews.Content: I ordered this computer based on the Amazon production that this computer had a 8x DVD/RWANDA drive. When I received the computer it did not include this drive at all. Very misleading production description by Amazon. I phoned customer service and they understood my issue. They emailed me a return authorization label to print out so I could take to UPS to return for full refund. Amazon was great on the return and credited my credit card for the full amount including shipping within 3 days.

ProductInfo.Features:
Intel Core i3-2365M 1.4 GHz
4GB memory, 500GB hard drive+ 24GB SSD
14" Touchscreen Screen, 1366 x768 Resolution
Intel HD Graphics 3000, Wi-Fi, 1 x USB 3.0, 2 x USB 2.0, HDMI, Bluetooth 4.0, Integrated Webcam and Microphone
3 cell polymer battery pack, up to 5 hours, Windows 8
ProductInfo.Name: ASUS VivoBook V400CA-DB31T 14-Inch Touchscreen Ultrabook (Black Aluminum)
